item.title: Outside 23 Sheringham road, 11th October
item.description:
Hi, my neighbor had both his and my pavement dug up to install Sky/Virgin internet a month ago. His pavement looks great, but mine is in terrible shape. It’s been patched together in a jigsaw-like manner, and nothing feels stable. Both my toddler and I have tripped over it while leaving the house multiple times, I see the school kids nearly going flying off their scooters as they leave school. The bit on the boundary of my property was concrete but has been dug up now is a pile of rocks . Please could this be fixed asap :)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sheringham Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trees have been pulled down, 11th October
item.description:
The new trees that have been planted recently have been damaged. One has been completely pulled down and another looks like an attempt was made. It's been like this for about 2 weeks. They are by the children's play area, near the entrance by Hollywood Way.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hazel Drive, Slade Green, London

item.title: Broken Disturbed Asbestos Cement Guttering next to public footway, 11th October
item.description:
This was already reported, but your Contractor is either Blind or telling Untruths about there attendance. Directions Drive into Rushmore Close BR1 2DJ, then turn Left, look over onto the green grassed area to their Left and the Asbestos Cement Guttering can be found laying in the grass as per provided image. Broken Disturbed Asbestos Cement is a danger to public health due to the release of micro particles into the air that can be breathed in by persons using the nearby public footpath and requires removal immediately, thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rushmore Close, Bickley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Repeated failure to weed Thompson Road despite labelling the issue “fixed”, 11th October
item.description:
There have been 10s of reports made on this app about Thompson Road being overgrown with weeds and it’s not been sorted despite issues being labelled “fixed”. Please can this be sorted by the end of w/c 13 October otherwise I will escalate.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Thompson Road, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet
